text:
This is good timing on the list as I’ve been looking for a replacement for
“Patch Manager Plus” and have been looking at these below and awaiting quotes.
We are a small shop, but do need 3rd party patching with cross-platform support
for Win, Mac & Linux which is why some others are not on this list. Would be
interested in what else people are using or looking at. 
It does worry me how we rely on their word that the product is secure, noting
can be 100% but jeepers the Ivanti saga. I’ve heard reports that re-imaging
machines from the Ivanti debacle is the only safe way forward – yikes. The irony
of a patch management system! 
(not in this order) 
* Quest – KACE Cloud
 * Syxsense
 * Pulseway
 * Qualys
 * Automox
 * NinjaOne 
Thanks 
Keith

From: 'Dave Lum' via PatchManagement <patchmanagement@googlegroups.com>
Date: Thursday, 8 February 2024 at 08:16
To: 'patchmanagement@googlegroups.com' <patchmanagement@googlegroups.com>
Subject: [patchmanagement] If not Ivanti, what? 
We have used Ivanti here for 9ish years, and I have been tasked with looking for
a replacement due to recent security vulnerabilities that have been discovered
in other Ivanti products. We patch ~600 servers with it and it has been an
easy-to-use tool and other than security concerns on other Ivanti products, have
no real issue with it. 
What is this lists’ thoughts on potential security issue with Ivanti Security
Controls and what other Windows patch management tools deserve a look? 
All thoughts/comments welcome. 
Dave
